# Brute
[color=Gold]Brute[/color]: - [color=DeepSkyBlue]Blunt[/color] - [color=DeepSkyBlue]Slash[/color] - [color=DeepSkyBlue]Piercing[/color]
Brute damage is the group of damage your patients take from being hit with melee weapons, shot with bullets, scratched by rats, and any other brutish method of inflicting injuries.
## Treatment All of the current cures to brute damage target the [color=Gold]damage group[/color], not individual types. The most common methods to cure brute damage are Bruise Packs and a chemical called [color=#ffaa00]Bicaridine[/color].
## Visual Diagnosis You can diagnose brute damage with a visual health inspection by refering to the following:
[color=DeepSkyBlue]Blunt[/color] 25+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Blunt[/color] - [color=red]They have minor contusions across their body.[/color] 50+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Blunt[/color] - [color=crimson]They have major bruises all over their body![/color] 75+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Blunt[/color] - [color=crimson]Their body is completely covered in lesions![/color] [color=DeepSkyBlue]Slash[/color] 10+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Slash[/color] - [color=red]They have some minor cuts.[/color] 25+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Slash[/color] - [color=red]They have lacerations across their body.[/color] 50+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Slash[/color] - [color=crimson]They have major gashes all over their body![/color] 75+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Slash[/color] - [color=crimson]Their body is completely mauled![/color] [color=DeepSkyBlue]Piercing[/color] 50+ [color=DeepSkyBlue]Piercing[/color] - [color=crimson]They have deep wounds all over their body![/color]
